Data.event_text: At 1507  The Beijing Aerospace Command and Control Center issued a command for the separation of the lander and the patrol device from the Chang'e 4 relay satellite.
At 2222  The patrol began to separate, and it(玉兔二號月球車) stepped on the far side of moon.
In Ningbo, Xiangshan, a fishing boat sank with 7 people. Two were rescued while five were missing.
2019 Yancheng chemical plant explosion
Zaoyang car explosion
Muli County Forest Fire, causing 31 deaths, mainly firefighters
Shenzhen Short-term Extreme Heavy Rainfall, causing 11 deaths
Chinese first test-tube baby becomes mother.

Data.event_text: (Washington time)  US President Donald Trump announced that the punitive tariff rate on Mainland China goods of US$200 billion will be raised to 25% from .
(Beijing time)  At a regular press conference, A spokesman of the Ministry of Commerce said that China is well prepared to deal with all possible preparations.
Google suspends business relationship with Huawei. This event comes following the arrest of Meng Wanzhou by Canadian authorities at the request of the United States due to sanctions against Iran.

links.text: -"Google suspends some business with Huawei, restricts access to Android updates | CBC News".-

Data.event_text: The 30th Anniversary of the 1989 Tiananmen Square Protests, Chinese authorities launched an extensive "stability maintenance" campaign. Hundreds of Twitter accounts were blocked. Internationally several organizations including the National Endowment for Democracy, the German Green Party Faction, and the British China Labour Solidarity have remembered the protests with events and protests.
Hundreds of thousands of people march in Hong Kong against a law critics fear could let China target political opponents in the territory.

links.text: -"Hong Kong protesters demonstrate against extradition bill", BBC News, June 9, 2019, retrieved August 12, 2019-

Data.event_text: Between 388,000 and 2,000,000 protesters take to the streets of Hong Kong against an anti-extradition law they believe will break down the firewall between Hong Kong and the mainland.
- An earthquake with a magnitude of 5.8 kills 13 and injures less than 200.

links.text: -"Rescue operation continues as death toll rises to 13 in China earthquake". chinaplus.cri.cn. Retrieved October 21, 2022.-

Data.event_text: － The "Regulations on the Management of Domestic Waste in Shanghai" came into effect, announcing that Shanghai entered the era of mandatory household waste classification.

－ the People's Bank of China held a press conference on financial statistics in the first half of 2019. Overall, the current banking system is reasonably abundant, the monetary credit and social financing scale are growing moderately, and the market interest rate is running smoothly.
32 are killed and 1,000,000 are evacuated as Typhoon Lekima makes landfall in Zhejiang. Earlier it had caused flooding in the Philippines.

links.text: -"Devastating photos show the damage of Typhoon Lekima, which left at least 32 people dead and forced 1 million to evacuate in China", Business Insider, retrieved August 11, 2019-

Data.event_text: — Hong Kong flights are canceled due to protests.

links.text: -"Hong Kong flights cancelled as protests continue and horrifying pictures show extent of violence", News Corp Australia Network, August 12, 2019, retrieved August 12, 2019-

Data.event_text: — Actress Liu Yifei posts a pro-Hong Kong police comment on Weibo, sparking a call for a boycott of the movie she stars in, Mulan.

links.text: -"Liu Yifei: Mulan boycott urged after star backs HK police", BBC News, August 16, 2019, retrieved August 16, 2019-

Data.event_text: — As many as 1.7 million demonstrators march during a rainstorm in the 11th week of anti-government protests in Hong Kong.

links.text: -"Largest Hong Kong Protest in Weeks Defies Threats, Intimidation by China", Democracy Now!, August 19, 2019, retrieved August 19, 2019-

Data.event_text: YouTube announces that it has disabled 210 channels linked to the Hong Kong protest campaign. This follows similar actions by Twitter and Facebook.

links.text: -"YouTube pulls 210 channels linked to Hong Kong protests influence campaign", Global News.ca, August 22, 2019, retrieved August 22, 2019-

Data.event_text: Protests in Hong Kong enter their 12th week as police reintroduced water-cannons and tear gas.

links.text: -Jessie Yeung; Sandy Sidu (August 25, 2019), "Live ammunition, petrol bombs and water cannons mark violent escalation in Hong Kong protests", CNN.com, retrieved August 25, 2019-

Data.event_text: - Costco opens their first store in China in Shanghai's Minhang district. During the day, the store closed early due to massive crowds.
Videos on Twitter and YouTube that show hundreds of shackled, blindfolded prisoners with shaved heads, presumed to be Uighur Muslims in Korla, Xinjiang, appear to be authentic.

links.text: -"Hundreds of shackled, blindfolded prisoners in China purportedly seen in online videos: report", Fox News, September 21, 2019, retrieved September 21, 2019-

Data.event_text: — 70th anniversary of the People's Republic of China

The World Health Organization was informed of a cluster of cases of pneumonia of unknown cause detected in Wuhan City, Hubei. The illness would come to be identified as coronavirus disease 2019 (also known as COVID-19), and the virus that causes the disease would be named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (or SARS-CoV-2).
